intro: Osterdamia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, bell-like flowers that come in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Osterdamia japonica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
